1.description: One of Japan’s two main jujutsu schools, dedicated to training sorcerers

2.description: Standard teaching rooms for lessons and training; Gojo uses one for his students

3.description: A talisman-covered cell used for secret executions, once holding Yuji and Yuta.

4.description: Large personal rooms for students, customizable; many remain unused due to low student numbers.

5.description: Facility where fallen sorcerers’ bodies are brought back for mourning and proper disposal.

6.description: A concealed room used by Gojo to hide and train Yuji; later a regrouping spot for students.

7.description: The entrance path to the school, a long staircase through torii gates beyond Tengen’s barrier.

8.description: One of Japan’s two main jujutsu schools, dedicated to training sorcerers.

10.description: A secured facility used to store cursed tools and objects. Its concealment barrier was breached by both curses and sorcerers, and after Shibuya most items were claimed by the Zenin and Kamo clans.

11.description: A local high school attended by Yuji, Iguchi, and Sasaki. Home of the Occult Research Club, which accidentally unsealed one of Sukuna’s fingers, causing a cursed spirit outbreak across the school.

12.description: The hospital where Yuji’s grandfather spent his final days in 2018. After giving Yuji his last advice to use his strength to help others, he passed away peacefully.

13.description: The main railway hub in Shibuya, connected to multiple complexes like Hikarie and Tokyu Department Store. During the Shibuya Incident, it became a central battlefield, including Yuji’s fight with Choso and Gojo’s eventual sealing.

14.description: A street near Shibuya Station where many civilians were trapped early in the Incident, later serving as battlegrounds for Megumi, Shigemo, Sukuna, and Mahoraga.

15.description: A prominent cemetery in Harajuku near Meiji-Jinguemae Station, used as the Mei Mei Team’s initial position during the Shibuya Incident.

16.description: The station connecting Meiji and Jinguemae. Was the entry point where Yuji entered the station and exorcised Ko-guy.

17.description: A forty-story skyscraper with a rooftop helipad, notable battleground for Yuji, Megumi, Awasaka, and Ogami’s forces.

18.location_name: Metropolitan Expressway, Route No. 3: Shibuya Line
18.description: Highway near Shibuya Tower where Yuji and Megumi fought Awasaka; later used as a medical base with Shoko Ieiri stationed there.

19.description: Road with substations near Shibuya Station; Nobara and Akari encountered Shigemo here before Nanami intervened inside the Bunkamura substation.

20.description: A narrow alley where Nobara fought Mahito’s clone, injuring his soul before he retreated to Shibuya Station.

21.description: One of Shibuya’s shopping areas, later a dangerous no-man’s-land; Yuta Okkotsu rescued a child here while exorcising a lurking cursed spirit.

22.description: A substation of the main complex, located near Shin Minami with Caffe Velace nearby; initial posting site for Team Kusakabe.

23.description: A landmark shopping and office complex in Shibuya, connected underground to the Fukutoshin Line. Thousands gathered here during Halloween Night.

24.description: Located on B5F beneath Hikarie, this underground railway platform was the site of Gojo’s battle against Mahito’s allies and the sealing of Gojo in Prison Realm.

25.description: Parallel subway lines under Shoto Bunkamura Street; battleground where Nobara and Nitta faced Shigemo before Nanami intervened after saving Ijichi.

26.description: An underground fight club in Tochigi Prefecture run by Kinji Hakari. It pits sorcerers against one another in hand-to-hand combat and serves as a major setting during the Perfect Preparation Arc.

27.description: The first Tokyo colony covering Shinjuku and Ikebukuro, known for heavy player activity due to abundant supplies. Higuruma used a theater as his base, while Reggie operated from an apartment near Kahamecho Station.

28.description: The second Tokyo colony, spanning the city and bordering seas infested with cursed spirits. Battles included Hakari vs. Charles Bernard in an amusement park and Hakari/Panda vs. Kashimo near a shipping yard.

29.description: Covers nearly all of Sendai City in Miyagi Prefecture. Fighting escalated rapidly after November 1st, becoming one of the bloodiest and most intense colonies compared to Tokyo.

30.description: Located in Kyushu near Kagoshima, bordering the sea and forests with the Sakurajima volcano visible. By November 2nd the city was abandoned, setting the stage for Maki’s battle against Naoya.

31.description: Located in Iwate Prefecture, centered around Lake Gosho. Most fighting on December 24th took place across mountainous roads and forests surrounding the lake.

32.description: Shinjuku is a city-level ward that serves as a major commercial and administrative district in Tokyo. According to Suguru Geto, Shinjuku is considered "the crucible of curses".

33.description: A residential street in Tokyo where sorcerers gathered during the escort mission for Riko Amanai.

34.description: Riko’s personal residence in Tokyo, briefly shown during her introduction in the Gojo’s Past Arc.

35.description: The school Riko Amanai attended, where Gojo and Geto protected her from curse users and assassins.

36.location_name: House of the Children of the Star
36.description: The facility of the Time Vessel Association, a cult that worships Master Tengen and opposed Riko’s merger.

37.description: An unnamed elementary school in Tokyo where a curse-related event took place during a mission.

38.description: A bustling shopping complex in Tokyo that became the site of a dangerous cursed spirit incident.

39.description: A nightlife district in Tokyo that served as a battleground during sorcerer confrontations with curse users.

40.description: A Tokyo detention center where Yuji, Megumi, and Nobara encountered the first Special Grade Cursed Spirit they ever faced.

41.description: A nondescript Tokyo street where sorcerers clashed with curses during a mission.

42.description: A theater in Kawasaki City where Junpei Yoshino was manipulated by Mahito, leading to a tragic confrontation.

43.description: The underground sewers of Kawasaki where Yuji first battled Mahito in a deadly encounter.

44.description: A high school in Tokyo where Yuta Okkotsu was haunted by Rika Orimoto before enrolling at Jujutsu High.

45.description: A bridge in Tokyo infamous for curse activity, including the deaths tied to the Yasohachi Bridge Curse.

46.location_name: Tokyo Municipal Shūei High School Detached Office
46.description: A detached building of Shūei High in Kawasaki, appearing briefly in side-story mission

47.description: The estate of the Zenin Clan, marked by family strife, deadly succession battles, and Maki’s massacre.

48.description: A junior high school in Saitama where a Culling Game colony unfolded with multiple violent battles.

49.description: A beach in Okinawa visited during the Hidden Inventory Arc, where Gojo, Geto, and Riko spent a brief respite.

50.description: The airport in Okinawa used by Gojo’s group during the escort of Riko Amanai before returning to Tokyo.

51.description: The place where Geto and his group hid to plan the extinction of non-jujutsu humans
